full_text:
SCAM: This website claiming that there are jobs at Mara Resort is a hoax

PesaCheck's research shows there is no such hotel at the Maasai Mara National Reserve.

A website article advertising job vacancies at Mara Resort, located within the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Narok County, is a SCAM.

The job advert, shared on a Facebook page, claims they seek to recruit front desk staff, waiters/waitresses, room attendants, chef/ kitchen staff and cleaners. The net salaries for the available positions ranges from Ksh20,015 to Ksh38,455.

To qualify for the jobs, one must be a Kenyan citizen with at least a high school education (KCSE). The candidate's attitude must be good, with excellent written and verbal communication skills, friendly personality, integrity, customer service, time management skills, and attention to detail.

After performing a reverse image search, PesaCheck discovered that:
- The image used on the Mara Resort's job section page is from Welgevonden Private Game Reserve in South Africa
- The accommodation section image is from Tongabezi & Sindabezi in Zambia
- The contacts section photo is of wildebeest and zebras migrating at the Serengeti National Park in Tanzania

Mara Resort is not listed among the camps and lodges at the Maasai Mara National Reserve. Another red flag is that the job advert's Facebook page link originally read "Jobs — Mara Villanzia" but the URL was "mararesorts.co.ke".

Paul Tobiko, the director of communications at Narok County government, confirmed that these resorts do not exist. He warned about rising job scams asking applicants to pay fees for health and food handling certificates.

PesaCheck concludes that this is definitively a SCAM and warns job seekers to be vigilant.
title: Azzuri Shelpan Crest Resort is not listed among the resorts that are found in the Mara as seen here: https://www.masaimara.travel/hotels-camps-accommodation.php The resort is not also on Google Maps: https://www.google.com/maps/search/azzurri+shelpan+crest+resort,+Maasai+Mara,+Kenya+/@-1.5106364,35.0901459,12z/data=!3m1!4b1 The resort is not also a registered company: https://brs.ecitizen.go.ke/accounts/32373496/find-business/13?_utf8=%E2%9C%93&application_id=&search%5Btype%5D=company&search%5Bprotect%5D=true&search%5Bq%5D=azzurri+shelpan+crest+resort&submit= A screenshot has been shared on social media showing that applicants are required to pay Ksh2485 for a food handling certificate. This is a red flag as the certificate goes for a lower price and it can be obtained on the county government website. Read the attached article for further information.
vclaim: A website is falsely advertising job vacancies at a non-existent "Mara Resort" within the Maasai Mara National Reserve. The scam website uses stolen images from other African locations, including South Africa, Zambia, and Tanzania. The fake job listings promise salaries ranging from Ksh20,015 to Ksh38,455 for various hospitality positions. Narok County government officials have confirmed that the resort does not exist and warned about scammers requesting fees for certificates from job applicants.
